intro: Penicillaria gymnothrix, commonly known as the naked-stemmed penicillaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a slender, often hairless stem and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense cluster. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Penicillaria gymnothrix is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
